a.g: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray

a.g: [But] who are heedless of their prayer -
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol1 book 4
Indeed, Abu Al-'Aliyah was asked about His saying, the Most High: "Those who are heedless [sahun] of their prayer [salat]." He said: It is he who is heedless [yas-haw] in his prayer [salat], so he does not know upon what he concludesâ€”whether upon an even [shaf'] or an odd [watr]. And Al-Hasan said: It is he who is heedless [yas-haw] of the time of the prayer [salat] until it passes. And some of them said: It is he who, if he prays it at the beginning of its time, does not rejoice, and if he delays it beyond its time, does not grieve, so he does not see hastening it as a good [khayr] nor delaying it as a sin [ithm].
